intro: Euphrasia × calvescens, commonly known as the common eyebright, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and early summer. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and often hairy. Euphrasia × calvescens is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat eye ailments and other inflammatory conditions.
